issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

fields.summary: Add user info in the YARN ClientToken

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

fields.description: When MRClientService receives requests, it calls verifyAndGetJob which does not actually validate that the current user has the proper access.
fields.summary: MRClientService does not verify ACLs properly

comments.body: Patch to verify ACLs and improve logging of requests.
+1 pending jenkins, lgtm. Thanks [~jlowe]!

{color:green}+1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12599243/MAPREDUCE-5475.patch
  against trunk revision .

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:green}+1 tests included{color}.  The patch appears to include 1 new or modified test files.

    {color:green}+1 javac{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    {color:green}+1 javadoc{color}.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    {color:green}+1 eclipse:eclipse{color}.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    {color:green}+1 findbugs{color}.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    {color:green}+1 release audit{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    {color:green}+1 core tests{color}.  The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-app.

    {color:green}+1 contrib tests{color}.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/3951//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/3951//console

This message is automatically generated.
I just committed this. Thanks [~jlowe]!

Good changes look good to me too. +1 after the fact.

We could do more with testing
 - Validate the specific message on AccessControlException
 - Negative tests for view-acl and 
 - Positive tests for modify-acl.

If you agree, I'll file a new ticket.

* /hadoop/common/trunk/hadoop-mapreduce-project/hadoop-mapreduce-client/hadoop-mapreduce-client-app/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/mapreduce/v2/app/TestMRClientService.java

+1 for a followup JIRA for more rigorous testing.

Adding a patch for branch-0.23.  If you could give it a quick review, I'd be happy to commit.  Thanks!

Reopening, as this appears to be causing problems on a secure cluster.  Getting exceptions on the job submission client after the job starts running and it tries to connect to monitor the job:

13/08/22 18:51:59 ERROR security.UserGroupInformation:
PriviledgedActionException as:x@y (auth:KERBEROS)
cause:java.io.IOException: org.apache.hadoop.security.AccessControlException:
User appattempt_1377189855273_0006_000001 cannot perform operation VIEW_JOB

Will revert the change for now until we better understand what's going on.
The logged in user is AppAttemptId for client tokens, so for user based auth we need the appSubmitter in the token. Looks like we'll need YARN-707, working on it.
Reverted.  [~vinodkv] indicated in an offline discussion that this is probably due to the lack of user info in the YARN client token, see YARN-707.

Verified that the original patch works on a secure cluster once YARN-707 was committed, so I committed this again to trunk, branch-2, and branch-2.1-beta.

Reverting this again... With YARN-707 users can see their own jobs again, but other users can still kill them because the token user is always the app submitter, and the AM sees all authenticated client connections coming from that user.

[~vinodkv], are you OK with this being committed now that YARN-707 has added the client name to the client-to-AM token?
+1 Would have been nice to avoid redundancy by having a method for the try/throw block on getting the user.  It's ok as-is though.

Thanks for the review, Daryn.  I talked offline with [~vinodkv] and he was also OK with the patch going in after YARN-707.  I'll wrap up committing the 0.23 bits for YARN-707 then commit this as well.
